content.title: SUPER 30
content.beneficiary: Students appearing for class 10th Board Final Examination
content.details: The scheme 'Super 30' was launched by the Directorate of Secondary Education, Government of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide free coaching for JEE/ NEET to the students who are appearing in the class 10th Board Final Examination and want to pursue Science Stream in Class 11th & 12th with the aspiration to crack the JEE / NEET exam.
benefits: Covers accommodation fees of ₹1,40,000/- per annum (with 5% extra in 2nd year)
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.
The applicant should be a student.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST)/ Scheduled Caste (SC)/ Person with Disability (PH) community.
The student should have passed the class-10th Pre-Board/ Pre-Test Exam from the government-recognized school of Tripura with 50% marks.
The applicant should be appearing for the class 10th board final exam.
The annual income of the family of the applicant should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.
documents_required: Original Income Certificate issued by the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM)/ Deputy Commissioner of Magistrate (DCM).
Online generated Selection Test Admit Card.
Class X Board final mark sheet (60% and above marks applicable) including production of original marksheets.

faqs.question: What is the benefit provided under the Super 30 Scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the Super 30 Scheme, selected students may choose any nationally reputed Coaching Institution outside Tripura for a two-year coaching program for JEE/NEET, with capped coaching and accommodation fees.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Super 30 Scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligibility for the Super 30 Scheme includes being a resident of Tripura, a student from Scheduled Tribe (ST)/Scheduled Caste (SC)/Person with Disability (PH) community, passing the class 10th Pre-Board/Pre-Test Exam from recognized schools in Tripura with 50% marks, and the family's annual income not exceeding ₹1,00,000.

faqs.question: What is the selection procedure for students under the Super 30 Scheme?
faqs.answer: Selection for the Super 30 Scheme is based on the student's rank in the Selection Test and adherence to State Reservation Norms.

faqs.question: Are there any reserved seats for specially-abled students in the Super 30 Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, one reserved seat is allocated for specially-abled (Divyang) students under the Super 30 Scheme.

faqs.question: Can students from other states apply for the Super 30 Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only students from Tripura are eligible to apply for the Super 30 Scheme.
